raceDayNotes: Big scratches in Fountain of Youth - bummer...

postRaceComments: (5) Domingo - son of American Pharoah, wins on the turf
(2) Be You - wins, most experienced and faced good competition
(1) Big City and (8) Acclaimed Victor - early pace was too much for those horses

preRaceComments: (3) Just F Y I - late scratch.  Also very bummed she will not run today
(2) Leslie's Rose - should make things easy for Irad/Todd in this race
Big scratches with the 8 (Locked) and 3 (Victory Avenue)
(1) Speak Easy - one race, but very fast out of gate and solid throughout race
(5) Dornoch - M/L favorite and experienced horse.  Wondering if three month layoff helps, hurts, or no factor
(4) Real Macho - looked good in previous races - better competition today
A lot of even running lines for these horses
postRaceComments: Always great to see a 37-1 bomb start a card
(3) Hercules wins - nice pace, inside move
(1) Practical Way - 2/5 Post Time favorite led early, but faded badly

preRaceComments: (5) Mellifluous - Third start, slight class drop - hoping he figures things out today
(10) Mr Bolt - first time starter from outside post; tough ask but taking a lot of betting money
postRaceComments: (3) Snowname - wasn't able to finish in his first two races, but led early and had enough to win the race
(5) Mellifluous - Ok start, nice closing speed; didn't have enough distance to catch leader
(10) Mr Bolt - started race well but didn't have energy to finish the final furlong

preRaceComments: lots of first time starters
(12) Camera - second career race, first race seven months ago.  short price with a tough post
(3) Qualificata - looked good last race, a little improvement might be enough to win race
postRaceComments: (6) Very Practical - outstanding closing speed to win at the wire
(3) and (12) battled down the stretch, both looked strong in losing effort
(1) Alimara - Chad Brown turf horse, first race in U.S.; Started slow, outstanding closing speed
(9) Segesta - other Chad Brown horse in race; good for most of race, but tired at the end
(3) Skippylongstocking - won race this year and last year.  Nice pace, never a doubt best horse in race.
(1) Sterling Silver - 8/5 Post Time favorite off a layoff; recovered after poor start to win by a nose
(3) Sparkle Blue - nice ride by Jorge Ruiz, led throughout and finished well
(1) Fluffy Socks - even money favorite at post time; No excuses - she doesn't like her picture taken; A good place or show horse
(5) Wakesiu - Another good American Pharoah filly on the turf; nice ride by Junior Alvarado
(4) Kinza - Bob Baffert trained, looks like best 3 yr old Filly right now
(6) Sweet Azteca - wired the field
(2) Adare Manor - Post time favorite, no answer to the 6

raceDayNotes: Late Pick 5 - to reduce cost could single Money Supply (Race 9), Tarifa (Race 11), and/or Track Phantom (Race 12)
Early races - will look for how track plays; Early Speed versus Closers
Fair Grounds Oaks - Fun to see rematch of Tarifa and Intricate; also want to see if Our Pretty Women is ready to move up in class
Louisiana Derby - I like Track Phantom, but don't like his post.  A few others are great contenders
200 pt Kentucky Derby prep race - Blue Grass Stakes

postRaceComments: (5) Elephants Ear - Impressive, caught inside, was able to move out and very strong finish
(4) Bourbon Society - Improving, led early, held on for second
(7) Batten Down - Good race, but could not close on the 5 or 6
(2) Billal - Mott/Alvarado get it done this race.  Early speed, dominate down the strech
(4) Scatify - even with the 2 for most of race, gave way towards the end
(6) Discreet Mischief - Cox/Geroux, easy win
(5) Timeout - First time starter, nice finish but well back of winner
(6) Prevalence - 5/1 winner; not sure where that race came from.  Got out of the gate and wired the field
(2) White Palomino - Chad Brown trained, nice patient ride by Jose Ortiz
(14) El Rezeen - AE drew in; Pletcher trained - Irad Ortiz Jr. worked a nice trip for second

preRaceComments: (9) Minnesota Ready - hoping trainer (T. Amoss) and jockey (T. Gaffalione) change help this horse
(2) Wico - Good record at KEE and distance; Wesley Ward/Irad Ortiz Jr. will have plan for this race
(4) Raise Cain - a little bit of a layoff; hoping Luis Saez can get off to a faster start
postRaceComments: (6) Bo Cruz - wired the field, nice pace

preRaceComments: (10) Pounce - Good looking turf horse.  Casse/Castelliano have a good plan with this horse
postRaceComments: (9) Buchu - Nice ride by Martin Garcia, good looking horse

preRaceComments: (2) Red Carpet Ready - Good post/distance for this horse
(8) Valva - a Gun Runner kid, faced good competition in past races

postRaceComments: (3) Mischief Magic (IRE) - more of a pick of trainer (Charles Appleby) and jockey (Tyler Gaffalione)
(6) Arzak and (4) Beer Can Man - both coming off layoffs since BC Turf Sprint
(9) Panther Island and (11) Coppola - both had good performances at GP over the winter

preRaceComments: Tough race to handicap - top two horses already have points for KD entry; will they try different strategy in race?
(10) Sierra Leone - outside post, closer - will he be able to close on this field?
(4) Dornoch - Good post, early speed - will distance be too far for this horse?
All other entries - have potential to continue improvement and win race
(Also...) All other entries - could regress and not be a factor.  Need to prove they belong in this class field.
with overnight rain/sloppy track; updated race picks
(4) Sundance Feature - hoping Saez gets her out early and wires the field
postRaceComments: not sure if it will hold - but wet tracks at CD are very tough on outside horses

preRaceComments: (1) Weigh the Risks - inside post, didn't fire last time in a tough race off layoff; will need to improve
(9) Sidamara - best horse in the race, but I don't like the post on this sloppy track
postRaceComments: (9) Sidamara - had a little trouble early, but settled and great close
(11) Sedona - Nice ride by Irad on a horse coming off a layoff
(1) Weigh the Risks - led early, but faded after final turn

preRaceComments: (3) Prove Worthly - last race good - first race in N. Casse barn and off layoff
(8) Arthur's Ride - great form, stepping up in class
(10) Brigadier General - solid past races, but needs a little better to win race
postRaceComments: (5) Injunction - overall great race/ride by Rosario; early pace, easy finish
(2) Fort Warren - Saez got the horse on the pace, held on for second
(3) Prove Worthy - late close, distant third place finish to refund my cheap MBS bet

preRaceComments: Thursday night/Friday morning rain means off turf
Howard's weather forecast was good - why do mean people make fun of him?
(16) Batucada - cheap win bet on MTO
(10) Stir Crazy - Four career starts on wet tracks, two wins, two place
postRaceComments: (10) Stir Crazy - wet track record held up

preRaceComments: (5) Pretty Mischievous - KY Oaks winner | good on wet track
(4) Idiomatic - off a bit of a layoff | great past performances | good early speed
(3) Stone Silent - three wins in three starts in B. Lynch barn | great early speed
(5) Elm Drive - Ran well in big races | Saez a good jockey for this race
postRaceComments: (2) Ova Charged - great sprint race | good thing only 5.5 Furlong distance
(9) Secret Money - challenged late, good for second place
(1) Run for the Hills - great finish | needed another half furlong

preRaceComments: (3) First Mission - liked last race, works, and connections
(1) Money Supply - Very solid, consistent races | good races on wet track
(10) Trademark - good races on wet track
(2) Steal Sunshine - Good enough to be in this race, will need a good trip to win
postRaceComments: Florent Geroux - Riding Pick 3 | Won last three races
(3) First Mission - liked last race, works, and connections
(8) T O Saint Denis (Jpn) - Fast early, begged for the wire | held for second
(5) Il Miracolo - nice finish to get up to third

preRaceComments: Spread race for me - no strong opinions | pick and pray
(4) Heavenly Sunday - off a little bit of a layoff; good 2023 year
(6) Surprisingly - has been good and close, like the jockey change to Prat
(10) Sprakle Blue - I'm not quite sure if she is ready to step up to this level of competition
(2) Aspen Grove - I'm not quite sure if she is ready to step up to this level of competition
postRaceComments: Jose Ortiz - third win of the day | having a great day
(1) Fast as Flight - 20/1 bomb | Great ride by J. Ortiz on yeilding turf
(10) Sprakle Blue, (2) Aspen Grove - close photo for second | nice closing speed for both
(4) Heavenly Sunday - Led most of the way | tired in home stretch

preRaceComments: (7) Denim and Pearls - running very well | lot to like about this girl
(11) My Mane Squeeze - not crazy about post | will need a better start to compete
(1) Impel - Young, inexperienced; could be ready to step up to this level of competition
postRaceComments: (11) My Mane Squeeze - great ride by Saez | horse made it look easy
(1) Impel - off the pace at start of race, nice recovery to get second
(7) Denim and Pearls - Rain, muddy track, or whatever - she didn't run well today

preRaceComments: (9) Hard to Justify - Young, inexperienced | Undefeated, will face best competition in her career
(4) Buchu - Consistent, will be tough in this race
(5) Mo Fox Givin - improving, but not sure if good enough to win this race
(6) Pounce - no idea what to make of that last race
postRaceComments: (10) Dynamic Pricing - the other Chad Brown turf horse in the race
(11) Way To Be Marie - Nice race stepping up in class

preRaceComments: (13) Just F Y I - don't like the post or only one race in 2024, but seems the most talented horse in the race
(5) Thorpedo Anna - Nice post, great stats in all career races
(12) Power Squeeze - Very good horse, nice career races
(11) Ways and Means - will be tough, only three career races, but all good
postRaceComments: (5) Thorpedo Anna - Wired the field | great ride by B. Hernandez
(13) Just F Y I - good race, could pass around the final turn | outside post may have been a factor
(2) Pure Force - first time starter for B. Cox/F. Geroux | Looked outstanding every step of the race
(3) Top Gun Rocket - looked good off the pace to get second
(6) Scylla - 2/5 favorite, wins easy
(11) Mindframe - Post time 1/2 favorite  | three scratches, but outside post didn't matter | Easy win
(2) Cornishman - held on to second
(1) Strong Quality - nice post | wired the field | Two wins for F. Geroux
(7) Kupuna - strong, good second place finish
(14) Cogburn - I didn't like the post, but great ride from I. Ortiz | Two wins for I. Ortiz
(6) Filo Di Arianna (BRZ) - Looked great, wasn't on my radar
(8) Mischief Magic (IRE) - Post time favorite (5/2) | closed up to third | no factor to winner
(10) Vahva - Irad tax paying today | solid, consistent race | I. Ortiz third win on the day
(7) Alva Starr - Led most of the way | gave way late
(3) Flying Connection - Good close to finish thrid

preRaceComments: (3) Chili Flag, (6) Delahaye, (11) Copice - which Chad Brown turf horse is going to defeat me?
postRaceComments: Chad Brown turf trifecta
(3) Chili Flag - I. Ortiz fourth win on the day
(11) Copice - strong finish, lost close photo for win
(6) Delahaye - good race, but third horse in the race

preRaceComments: (12) Nash - Always shows up, best record in race
(2) Beeline - lightly raced; a lot of upside potential
(4) Otto the Conqueror - Two for two at CD; could be a wise guy horse
postRaceComments: (5) Seize The Grey - Best race for this horse - nice race | Happy for The Coach | Unhappy for my bankroll... Wow, was that a kick in the @$%&* for my horizontal bets
(12) Nash - won a photo for second
(11) Valhos - Nice race from outside post | hung tough, but lost photo

preRaceComments: (5) Legend of Time - Godolphin/Appleby horse - those guys mean business when they ship horses over the pond
(10) Set - lightly raced, talented horse.  Will need to improve to be a factor
(11) Cugino - could be a factor with the right trip
postRaceComments: Well, that knocks out a lot of P6 and P5 tickets | I wasn't even close in this race | 47-1 over 24-1 over 36-1 over 7-1
(2) Trikari, (4) Formidable Man, (3) Lagynos - All great rides/trips | All 15-1 Morning Line

preRaceComments: (2) Tejano Twist - Great competition; Irad tax will be paid
(6) Zozos - I'm never sure what to do with this horse, but don't want him to beat me here
(11) Hoist the Gold - I don't like horses first back from overseas trip, but works look great
postRaceComments: (10) Gun Pilot - Solid pace, nice close, looked outstanding down the stretch
(5) Here Mi Song - Early speed, held on for second
(6) Zozos - Off layoff, didn't have a burst down the stretch
(2) Tejano Twist - fell back early, didn't recover

race.raceName: Old Forester Bourbon Turf Classic S.
preRaceComments: (6) I'm Very Busy - Looked great last race
(11) Naval Power - Godolphin/Appleby horse - always ready to go
postRaceComments: (5) Program Trading (GB) - Great ride by F. Prat | Won the photo
(11) Naval Power (GB) - Good race, just short of winning
(7) Webslinger - Solid third place finish
(1) Integration - Good showing, will pay more attention to this horse next time out

preRaceComments: Whoever gets the best trip wins the race...  Captain Obvious
(17) Fierceness - most talented horse in the race; Velazquez has a chance to get horse positioned and settled early in race
(2) Sierra Leone - HATE the post; will be difficult to work out a trip from the two; outstanding closing speed - will be fun to see the end if he is close down the stretch
(4) Catching Freedom - the other great closer in the race; should be a factor late
(12) Track Phantom - terrible post in two previous races; early speed; has a chance to get position early in race
(9) General Partner - don't like the layoff, but past performances are great
(2) Discreet Mischief, (7) Jefferson Street - Lightly raced with a lot of potential; first race out after breaking maiden
